instructions: Search title for age keywords. If found, assign corresponding age group. If NO keyword found, default to NON SPECIFIC (not ADULT). IMPORTANT: Do NOT extract age keywords from brand names or ingredient names (e.g., 'Elderberry' does NOT mean 'elder').
important_notes: ADULT and NON SPECIFIC are DIFFERENT values with different business rule implications
Only assign ADULT if the title explicitly contains 'adult' or 'adults' as a descriptor
If no age keyword is found, use NON SPECIFIC (do not assume ADULT)
Prenatal/pregnancy/postnatal products are coded as AGE GROUP - ADULT
IGNORE age keywords that appear in brand names (e.g., 'Baby's Only Organic' brand)
IGNORE age keywords that are part of ingredient names (e.g., 'Elderberry' contains 'elder' but is NOT an age indicator)
business_rule_context: In multivitamin subcategory logic: Age=ADULT+Gender=NON SPECIFIC → ADULT subcategory, but Age=NON SPECIFIC+Gender=NON SPECIFIC → NON-SPECIFIC subcategory. These are different outcomes.
r_system_note: The original R system had 6 age categories (NON SPECIFIC, CHILD, BABY, TEEN, ADULT, MATURE ADULT). Prenatal products were classified as ADULT, not as a separate category.
